intro: Chorizanthe flavescens, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. It grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss.
